result.execSummary:
The defendant Shamyra Roberta Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endanger Safety/Reckless Use of Firearm [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay DNA surcharge, all costs, fees and surcharges.  To be paid from 25% of prison funds.  If not paid during Extended supervision, case converts to civil judgment.  DV surcharge does not apply.
--Restitution set at zero.

superMiscConds.notes:
No drugs or alcohol.
No contact with victims Jada J. or her family or her residence,   April J., Louis J., Ambrea H., Jasone W., Theresa J., Taneah J., Darecee M., Laraysheo R., Alisa R., Dion H. or child D.M.
No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete anger management, and continue programming.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that her voting rights are suspended and she may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shamyra Roberta Nelson in court with attorney David Knute Ziemer.  Defendant Shamyra Roberta Nelson in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT #2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS, with credit for 336 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
* Successfully complete Anger Management, 
   and continue programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victims, Jada J. or her family 
  or her residence, April J., Louis J., 
  Ambrea H., Jazone W., Theresa J., 
  Taneah J., Darecee M., Laraysheo R., 
  Alisa R., Dion H. or child D.M. 
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Court ordered defendant to pay all costs, fees, and 
  surcharges, to be paid from 25% of prison funds, 
  and if not paid during period of extended supervision 
  case converts to civil judgment.
  -- dv surcharge does not apply.
* Restitution is set at zero.
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the 
  Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Defendant advised of right to seek postconviction relief, and appeal. 
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended and she may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Extended Supervision.    mld

Defendant Shamyra Roberta Nelson in court with attorney David Knute Ziemer.  Defendant Shamyra Roberta Nelson in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Original heading on motion filed by defense counsel was listed as a Motion to Suppress.  The State waived that defense counsel file a more proper motion.  Hearing on Defense Motion to Withdraw Plea proceeded.  Sworn for defense: Shamyra R. Nelson (defendant).  Defendant waived attorney client privilege.  Exhibit 1 offered and received.   Sworn for defense: Attorney Eric Hart.  Brief recess.  Testimony closed.  For the reasons as stated on the record, Court DENIED Defense Motion to Withdraw the Plea.   Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 1-30-2015 at 1:30 pm.  mld
from the State to Defense Motion to Withdraw Plea, signed and filed.   mld
Defendant's Motion To Supress, and Defendant's Affidavit In Support Of Motion, filed.
Original Transcript PLEA HEARING  (11 pages) commencing SEPTEMBR 8, 2014 received and filed.

Attorney Eric Richard Hart in court, defendant Shamyra Roberta Nelson not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 The Court was advised by Attorney David Ziemer, who was present, that he has been privately retained to represent defendant.  The Court heard and will allow Attorney Hart to withdraw as defense counsel, based on his conflict established in motion, before as counsel of record.  The Court will require a written statement from the defendant that she now wants Attorney Ziemer as her counsel of record.  Case adjourned for Hearing on Defense Motion to Withdraw Plea scheduled in Branch 4 on 12-18-2014 at 1:30 pm.  Defense counsel will be requesting transcripts for the dates of 9-8-2014 and 10-7-2014.  mld
to Withdraw from Attorney Eric Hart, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Shamyra Roberta Nelson in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart.  Defendant Shamyra Roberta Nelson in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

for Jury Trial scheduled 9/8/2014 in Branch 4

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #1, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

 AS TO COUNT #2:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 10-7-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Defendant Shamyra Roberta Nelson in court with attorney Eric R Hart.  Defendant Shamyra Roberta Nelson in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defense counsel was originally appointed to this case by the Public Defender's Office.  Defendant then subsequently hired Robert D'Arruda.  Defendant is still eligible for a Public Defender, and Attorney Hart will now continue as defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 9-8-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Attorney Eric R Hart in court, defendant Shamyra Roberta Nelson not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Attorney Hart is currently the attorney of record on this case.  Defendant previously retained attorney D'Arruda as defense counsel, who is no longer practing law.  Today, defense counsel was provided a fresh set of discovery from the State.  To allow defendant the opportunity to determine if she would like to proceed on case with new counsel, Court ordered case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-12-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Defendant Shamyra Roberta Nelson in court with attorney Eric R Hart.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant recently retained Attorney D'Arruda as counsel, who is currently on a suspension, and his return date is unknown.  Attorney Hart, original counsel, will advise client of the current situation regarding Attorney D'Arruda, and if defendant is agreeable to having Attorney Hart as counsel.  Case adjourned for Status of Counsel in Branch 4 on 5-19-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Defendant Shamyra Roberta Nelson in court with attorney Eric R. Hart.  Defendant Shamyra Roberta Nelson in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defense is challenging the criminal complaint based on scribbner errors.  Court proceeded with the Preliminary Hearing, based on the two pagraphs as boxed by the Court, page 2 and 3 of the Complaint.        

  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officer Sarah Polka.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss heard  and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of discovery and an oral offer from the State.  This is a co-defendant case with another case, 2013CM2977 (Ed Pierson).  Case is adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4-10-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld
